sentence: So I thank Senator Merkley for shedding light on the risk--the risk  to our precious democracy and the risk to this incredible inheritance  from our Founders.
Senator Merkley, I appreciate everything you are doing to  highlight the many ways that this President has been undermining the  Constitution and the rule of law.
Senator Merkley, you and I are both members of the Senate  Appropriations Committee.
First, I want to begin by thanking our friend, and I say  ``our friend'' because he is more than my friend, Senator Merkley.
I ask that all the staff on the list from Senator Merkley's staff be  given all-access floor passes to the Senate floor during consideration  of H.

I further ask that there  be up to 30 minutes of debate on the resolution, equally divided  between the two leaders or their designees; further, that following the  use or yielding back of that time, the Senate vote on an amendment from  Senator Merkley, if offered, and following disposition of the Merkley  amendment, the Senate vote on the resolution, as amended, if amended,  with no further intervening action or debate, with 60 affirmative votes  required for adoption of the resolution.
I would transfer the remainder of my time to Senator Merkley.
I also want to recognize and thank my ranking member, Senator  Merkley.
I appreciate Chairperson McClain's efforts to advance the WIPPES Act,  along with Senator Merkley and Representative Mullin.
